I'm sober, and not trying to get into anything at 2am. My friend calls him rude and he gets all roid. We are totally civilized in calling him out on his behavior. He continues on with his "stop talking that stupid shit, bro" rant as we wait for our friends to come out. And at the same time the larger door guy starts shoving some guy who wanted to use the bathroom inside. He was telling him  not step to him and that's why he physically pushed him hack all the way to the corner. Really? He's 1/3 your width. Not called for. The skinny guy was not aggressive or rude. So physical force was ridiculous.  The roid dude finally disappears and our friends come out so we can finally leave.
I'm not one to put anyone on blast on yelp, but that was so highschool and such an unprofessional display right in front of their storefront I needed to let the Yelp commnity know. 
I'm embarrassed for Grant & Green Saloon to have these two working their doors...
author: Sherman A.

description: "Fairly pricey drinks are made up for by great live blues or jazz music in an intimate setting most nights with no cover, except occasionally weekends for big names. A lively, mostly upper 30s+ crowd. Not a good place if you want to be able to talk, though if a live session is in action because it's LOUD."
author: Marc S.

description: Bring your friends, listen to a band you've never head and probably never will hear again, and enjoy the strongest mixed drinks this side of columbus street.  If that ACDC cover band comes back, somebody please let me know.  Not very swank, but just clean enough that you feel sane leaving your jacket behind the bar.
author: Mike V.

description: For its prime location at the heart of North Beach, the Grant & Green did not leave an indelible impression on me.  In fact, I only vaguely recall the decor on the interior.  I seem to recall talking to serious barflies and getting myself rather faded.  Still, with so little to recall, I probably won't go back.  When you have Amante, O'Reilly's, the Saloon, Northstar, and the Savoy within a couple of blocks, why even come in here?
author: David O.

description:
Great local pub showcasing great local talents.  It took us a few weeks before we were regularly admitted to all shows without having to pay a cover charge - sometimes, we'd feel special, but most of the time I couldn't help but think that the bouncer was too drunk to remember whether or not people had to pay to get in!   I'd like to think I was special.

I was there often enough and after a while, I didn't even need a drink to head over to Grant & Green - Just give me my Blues, a little dancing space, and I'm good to go!  Seriously, pretty much a dive with your regular locals on the same barstool every night but other great people nonetheless, locals and tourists alike, every night of the week just wanting some soulful Blues.  It's fun just walkin back and forth between here and the Saloon...
author: Olma M.

description:
I like dives, I really do, so based on the descriptions I thought I'd like Grant and Green...I was wrong. When I think dive I think dark, dingy, big booths/tables to hang out with friends, bad music on the jukebox, strong/cheap drinks, and maybe some regulars and/or old men sipping straight drinks at the bar. This place had two of those elements: dark and dingy. The music was VERY loud live jazz; we couldn't talk and we all had headaches by the end. There were just a bunch of uncomfortable tables so we all had sore asses too.
Getting Corona in a can did remind me of being in Puerto Vallarta for my senior trip but I am not sure if that is a good thing...
author: Lilly O.

description: My new Yelp rule is never give a place that is cash only 5 stars. We live in the 21st century now and places still don't accept cards. I believe this is just greed and I am the kind of person who despises carrying cash on me. This place is not a bar with a bunch of chicks so don't come here expecting a Bar None crowd. Mostly dudes who like dudes and hipsters.
author: Darius A.

description:
I've been here a couple of times, and I can't say that my experiences make me want to come back.  

It's a low key bar, with no cover.  Sound great, except you can barely get through the door.  I get it, bars get crowded, it happens.  But the way the entrance and the bar is set up, you can barely get through because it's so narrow!  If you're lucky enough to get to the bar and order and drink, then you better not move from there.

If you're looking to go to a hot, musty place, where you have to fight your way to get through, then this is your spot.
author: Maggie L.

description: Great bar with great live music. Will definitely return next time I'm in Telegraph Hill.
author: Kevin L.

description: A decent venue to see live music if you don't mind dropping 10 pounds in the course of the evening from the oppressive temperature inside the bar. Also, beer prices are pretty outrageous - think $5 for a bottle of Red Stripe or a pint of Fat Tire. No cover, though, and for a somewhat dive bar they have surprisingly good sound.
author: phil h.

description:
I could hardly catch my breath it was so hot in this bar (and on a REALLY cold night in SF).  It is super stuffy and with bands playing in there it is WAYYYY too small for the acoustics they have going on in there.  When I left my ears were ringing for days - that can't be good can it?!  

If you go with a group of people, don't expect to be able to talk to anyone other than the person sitting right next to you...even then you have to yell in their ear.  The bands are fantastic, but I like to hear them without flinching when they get closer to the mic. 

I asked for a dirty martini and while it wasn't very expensive, it was ITSY BITSY.  Imagine a tumbler, but half that size.  I was pretty disappointed.  They have pear cider here, which I love.  I wish more places had it available. 

Overall: 2 stars - Way too crowded, way too small, no air, and small drinks.  Oh, and CASH ONLY people!  If you come with a debit or credit card you're screwed.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
There are a few things I dread more than going to North Beach on the weekends.  Something really awful happened in the few years I took a break from the bay area.  But we went to see a friend's band play here last weekend and I enjoyed a great drunken, asshole free night in North Beach at Grant & Green for many hours. It was great to have too fun sublimish bands for free. 

Funny enough, the north beach weekend was apparently still going on outside since a guy got knocked down in fight quicker than I'd ever seen in one of my cigarette breaks.
author: Mazi S.

description:
Been there a few times. Usually a decent band is playing. the place is a little seedy but it does the job.

Mickey's Grenades for $2 aren't bad either.

Ended up dancing with this Cougar for a while.  She offered to rock my world. I declined. Still have her number in my phone as "Cougar" though....
author: Adam L.

description: I live right around the corner and its a great place to come in for a beer and chill after a long week. they often have live music with no cover which is awesome. the bar tenders can be a bit rude which is why the lack of star but all in all a great place!
author: Sara g.

description:
Although there have already been several people who have commented about the cancellation of music at Grant & Green, I am compelled to comment as well.  I hauled ass all the way from the East Bay to come to a venue I would not normally frequent (sorry not into collar popping trying to relive their formidable college drinking binges) to see a friend's band play. I roll up a bit late, to find all my friends milling around the corner outside the bar. There is no tale tell sound of a live band spilling onto the street and every one seems a bit miffed. I am then immediately informed that the show has been canceled due to the pressing need to host a beer pong competition.

It is within every right for the manger of the bar to cancel a show where at least 20 people showed up specificity for in sake of his friends getting together to throw sweaty balls into glasses of lukewarm beer. Right....

Overall, I am disappointed with the venue and the behavior of the staff there. I would not go there again or bother spending my hard earned money on a crappy Bud Lite. Instead go somewhere that values the ambiance of live music and good staff.
author: Girl on the Bike s.

description:
dare i say this was one of the best gigs we've played?  this place is awesome.  great booze, friendly staff, good tunes, good times.

the only thing that could make it better is if they had a sound guy.
author: gerald p.

description:
Grant & Green is a solid option in North Beach.  It's a good place to meet up with friends after eating at some of the great restaurants in the area.  I like the big screen TVs that tend to have sports on, and the live music is usually really good.  You can't see the bands from all parts of the bar (e.g. the front portion of the main bar), but in general there is good standing room and it is not overly crowded. 

The bartenders have always been friendly and prompt, and tables are always good to congregate around.  They do have a tendency to have the music too loud so that it can be hard to talk to people.
author: Lemar H.

description:
Went here after we went to North Beach Pizza and then had a drink at the Saloon. This is a decent bar, good drink selection and you don't have to pay a cover. I think they usually have live music every night. Good place to have a drink or two.

This is a cash only bar! My Vodka/Cranberry was $5 and bottles of beer are $6.
author: Jaclyn P.

description:
Wouldn't go so far to call this place a "dive bar," if for any other reason, there's not a real sense of "local joint to grab some drinks with some regulars from the neighborhood." 

Like a lot of places in North Beach, there's always a constant stream of out-of-towners (or out-of-North-Beachers) coming and going, peeking through the window to size the place up, etc.

It's hard to say what this place is...but whatever it is, it's not good. The vibe is weird, the music is way too loud, and the street is filled with too many packs of dudes on the prowl for booty or a brawl. Bottom line: It's just hard to get behind the G&G.
author: Derek R.

description: Grant and Green is located on the corner of Grant and Green in North Beach.  There is no cover and the drinks are cheap.  Grant and Green regularly showcases live music, accommodating at least a five piece band on a small stage.  Patrons can dance and drink in an intimate setting.  If hunger strikes, head over to nearby Golden Boy Pizza for a quick slice of delicious pizza at an affordable price.
author: Camille K.

description: Grab a beer and watch some sports. The occasional live fusion jazz bands happen to be pretty good, too.
author: Y K.

description:
For some reason my droogs wanted to watch the World cup game at the Steps of Rome. Afterwards they were going to crowd themselves into a phone booth. 
A friend called to watch the match here and once I got past the crowded front room I had enough space for old school break dancing but based on the bad officiating I did not take part in old school break dancing. 
They set up an extra bar so even though the place was packed I was able to get a drink quickly.
author: Marcus R.

description:
The place has a nice feel to it, but cheap drinks?  How drunk were you?  Five bucks for a beer is a bit pricey, but it IS North Beach so...eh.  

Nice music, decently mixed crowd, usually allright getting a drink, and the bathrooms are indeed fantabulous.
author: Brian H.

description:
Grant and Green on the surface appears to be a great place. Friendly neighborhood bar with live music. However, if you looked up the word "douchebag" in the dictionary, you would see a picture of the bald bartender that works here. 

Overcharged my friend about $15 for 3 drinks he ordered. Pretty much belittled another friend I was with. Had no respect for the girls in our party...I could go on. Be sure and check your tab if you order from this joker. 

Gets 2 stars for the music.
author: Brian W.

description:
This is the bar that is closest to my house and as such, I have become one of the foremost experts on it.
Beer on tap, but not in pitchers.
Monday night Live Jazz, Tuesday nights are Karaoke night.
Every other night  there's pretty good live music with no cover, which I don't think you can say about any other NB bar.
The crowd, in my experience, depends on the band that's playing.
The people who work here rule!
author: Joseph H.

description: i like this place... it wasn't overly crowded, played good music, i think they had a live band but they were finished by the time we got there... but it seems like a good venue for some intimate live shows. The bartenders were nice. But the bathroom situation is a little weird. two bathrooms position in the middle of the bar for unisex use... can get a little dirty and a little awkward and a little intense. but other than that the experience was A OK!
author: Shadi N.

description: We dropped in here the other night just in time to grab some barstools and found an excellent 90's cover band; the place filled up and quickly got pretty crowded.   I'd prefer paying less than $3 for a PBR can, but I guess it could be worse and they'll only set you back $1 during happy hour.
author: dan d.

description: Live music, fun atmosphere, and next door to Maggies. :) The drinks are ALWAYS strong, and the bartenders are efficient and entertaining. It is cash only, & they do have a ATM as well.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Great atmosphere and awesome live reggae band. Gonna have to be my newest staple in San Fran. Silly place to meet people, friends, and arch-nemeses.
author: Michael B.

description:
This is painful. Grant and Green was an awesome place to see a friend's band on a recent night. The bouncer was nice and proactive about keeping the already-drunk-and-rowdies out. The drinks were ok and not too overpriced. One of the bartenders, however, needs a lesson from Miss Manners and so here I am to administer:

Dear Bartender with the tattoos,
Thank you for being a complete bitch to my best friend, one of the nicest, smartest, most intelligent and respectful men I have known ever in my entire life. Not only  was he a shining star in a sea of douchebags last Friday night at your bar, but he was also the only patron I saw you berate, yell at, and more or less ask to leave. And why? Why did you do that, evil wench? Because he has a real JOB (he's a doctor) that requires him to carry a work bag and he had just gotten off a flight from LA and came straight to the bar to see our friend's band play. With all the handsiness and douchebaggery going on in your bar on Friday, I find it appalling that you chose to single out my friend for having a LAPTOP bag with him. You claimed it "wasn't working" to have it in the bar because it was "in your way" and that's not all you said.  And nothing you said was said in a remotely polite manner. Well, thanks to you, we all left. About 20 of us. 20 nice people who also happen to be good tippers and who were simply there to support our friend's band. Nice job. I hope you don't treat everyone with an education and a strong work ethic like this. Oh, maybe you do. That would explain the majority of your patrons I observed on Friday night.
author: Autumn K.

description: I once saw a broken beer bottle fight here, involving a woman in a halter top made of feathers. And it was the '90s. This is the first place people go when they are released from San Quentin.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
just so-so and lemme discuss: skanks galore. skanks who don't know how to dress, skanks who don't know how to flirt. my prelude to dinner at Soldini's turned into a nightmare. 2 cocktails for the man and me, developing a nice buzz, enjoying the crowd (mostly frat types), until the plain loud janes clad in non-designer jeans, sporting skeezy long greasy hair, wearing the ubiquitous nasty flip-flops w/unpedicured smelly feet arrived in full force. go ahead fugly bitch, squeeze your fat ass into the bar stool next to me. you touch my Vuitton bag again, you'll be missing your dykey unmanicured man-hands.

these femi-nazis who are aching for boy attention surely know how to bring aversion upon themselves. downing their pints (what else do she-boys drink ?), getting louder by the second, adding dimensions to the word obnoxious. these female things are the new boys of the millennium, and every time I've been in this bar, they have polluted the place. the frat boys left in disgust after 20 mins, as did we.

next trip to Soldini's: I will patronize the in-house bar, which really has stronger pours than G & G. but G & G is a pretty cool saloon . . . they just need a sign outside that states "NO SKANKS ALLOWED"
author: Prima D.

description: Say what you will about North Beach - I get it, and for the most part, I'm right there with you - but Grant & Green is a great bar. It all starts with who mans the drinks, and I don't think G & G knows how to hire bad staff. Everyone who works here is friendly, and so far, I've yet to receive a bad pour. It's also a great place to catch random live bands and comedy, and even play a little beer pong. If you're looking for a bar in the area where you can come as you are, have a beer, and maybe even hear some live music, this is the spot.
author: Kat E.

description:
$4 for a pabst? and you fired my favorite bartender? and you whine to yelp when people have the gall to say they don't like your whack-ass bar? are you fucking kidding?

no, you are NOT kidding. really pricey drinks in a divey setting, some legitimately awful live music (but some good, it is true), few redeeming qualities and way too many better options -- on the same block -- to justify any of it.

fuck this place; i'm going to maggie's.
author: Chris R.

description:
Just, no.  I used to go here all the time when Robbie & crew owned it, and the current owners are not an improvement.  North Beach does not need freakin' beer pong - we are not the Marina.  

Even worse - when I alerted the owner to the fact that a very drunk girl had been followed into the bathroom by a strange man, he first said, "That's not my problem, it's [the bar manager's]."  When I reminded him that as the owner, he's responsible for what goes on in the bar, he said, "Well, she'll get what she deserves."  Combine that with the known dosing that goes on, and this is not a good bar for women to go to.  

Plus, they crank the sound system up to an insanely loud level, even on weekdays  when the neighborhood is quiet.  (Yes, North Beach can be quiet.)  This is not a good bar anymore, and this is not a safe bar.  It's too bad, because they do have some awesome bartenders.  But still, no.
author: juliana e.

description: Pabst in cans? Automatic 4 stars. Add a little snake juice, Giant's baseball, some Marshall Law, you have a recipe for the perfect local bar. It can get loud once the live music starts, so if you're looking to chill...this is probably not your best bet. Don't let the Snake Juice (ask for it by name) go to your head, mix it up with the local toughguys, and see what happens. Personally I love this place, I feel really comforatble with the diverse crowd...My girl feels comfortable with the crowd as well (she takes shots of snake juice, what a hottie!). Usually a great getaway from the usual bar scenes around town. Good down-to-earth fun. Tell Manny that I sent you.
author: Ben R.

description: havin' lived in northbeach many moons ago....up above the kearny steps..coit tower hill....grant 'n' green just a stroll down hill to the bottom....a frequent stop during the ol' grant street pub-crawl.....crowds haven't changed much.....out of towners stickin' to the main broadway 'n' columbus roads....grant 'n' green still safe bet for locals.....beers, booze and mingle....seekin' a mellow evening...early is best....towards the peak hours....crowds, loudness and bands pursue....
author: Hen A.

description: I hold the 2nd and 4th highest scores on porno-photo hunt. This bar rocks!
author: Justy L.

description: I've been here a few times, but thought the bartender working last fri was a dbag.  Other than that, music and crowd were ok.
author: Mike M.

description: Had a blast here friday night watching an upbeat cover band get their funk on with some irresistable Kelly Clarkson covers.  Can't say anything about the bartending, because I was already nice & snookered by the time I showed up, but I met some nice B&T boys who dragged us across the street for free Fernet shots.  Hurray!
author: Ann M.

description: I've only been here once.  Made a friend with some drunk guy who imports Belgian cookies or something.  I bet cute boys come here a lot.  I like cute boys.
author: Coco D.

description: I go here once in a while because it's near work and sometimes friends play shows there. That's really all I have to say about the place. Normal kinda dirty bar with kinda okay people hanging around.
author: Constance C.

description:
a very lackluster bar. it has no character, whatsoever: it's not big. it's not small. it's not light. it's not dark. nothing special as far as decor goes. it's basically just... there. 

it's name well reflects it's lack of ingenuity.

i had some cheap beer for a happy hour special, but that's about it. 

boring.
author: Kayla K.

description: I lived just a block away from this place a few months ago, and we would stop here frequently before cruzin around the rest of north beach. They always have some type of live music and on a friday or saturday the place is usually pretty crowded. It's pretty small and hardly anywhere to sit. Every time I have been here it's taken a while to even get a drink. The crowd is a little mixed depending on the music which is good, but I don't think I would spend my whole night here, it's a convient place to stop for a drink but that's about it.
author: Danielle K.

description: The bar was crowded but the people were a fun bunch. People who were there just wanting to watch live music for free on Thursday nights and have a cheap drink. Lots of places around this North Beach area to walk around and check out. I went here to watch a Weezer cover band. The sound of the PA is pretty good so I liked it. Kinda stank like an armpit though. But what else can you expect from a saloon?
author: Chino B.

description: My friend loves this place for some reason so I've been here a few times. Not my favorite place. They do have live music which is kinda cool. That's about it...
author: Nicole F.

description: Free live music? I'm there! This is another one of those cash-only bars, but the drinks are reasonably priced. The crowd is always decent and it's my go-to place for music on the weekends. Hasn't failed me yet.
author: Kim L.

description: I came here with two other people on a Friday night two weeks ago. I was appalled at the service we got from the blonde bartender.  After ordering our second round of drinks (that was the same as the first) she came up with two opened beers of the wrong kind.  I politely informed her we were not drinking that kind and she looked at me and gave me attitude replying " well sorry, I already opened them."  I was stunned. I could not believe any bartender would behave in such a manor!  Then when I simply said we had ordered someting different and I am sorry she came at me telling me how b"tchy I was.  We walked out right then and there.  I will not be going back there.  Poor management to let someone so rude talk to costumers like that.
author: Maria D.

description:
if you like to get constantly hit on by all types of men that do not equal attractive, come here. i love it when a man tries to hit on you and you turn them down and then they get pissed at you. turns me on.

"oh, wait...is that your boyfriend over there?"
"yeah."
"FIGURES!" hits the table and goes into the one person bathroom with his wingman.
author: NF T.

description: This bar definitely needs more than a single door guy.  Two entrances and too many violent drunk knuckleheads  in bathroom lines.
author: Oleg S.

description:
This bar is awful, and I'll tell you why.

Its a boring bar to begin with, I yawn everytime I'm there, waiting for my friends to finish their drinks so we can hit the next  bar.

But what really put this bar on my shit list is one Saturday night when me and a couple of friends stopped in for a quick drink before last call.  I bought a round and gave the tall bartender with a hat on my check card and told him to close it out.  Within 2 min he manages to GIVE MY CHECK CARD TO ANOTHER CUSTOMER!!  When I asked him for it he said "i gave it to you," and blamed me for not having it.  

The manager was not much better.  He said "check your pockets."  These idiots didnt do anything to solve the problem except blame everyone else but themselves.  I had to cancel my card and have my bank credit  my money back for drinks I didnt buy.

Bottom Line.....This bar sucks and so do their employees.  So many better bars to hang out at in North Beach than Grant & Green.
author: Richard C.

description: I like this place.  It is sort of a dive bar and has free live music and no cover charge.  Drinks are reasonably priced.
author: Danielle B.

description: If you're a fan of live music coming from obscure local bands, this is your place. It is very loud here where conversation does not come easy. Drinks were expensive for a dump like this, but it is SF and a somewhat pricey area. Barback kept climbing over patrons to get behind the bar which I thought was odd. Went next door to Maggie McGarry's which could not be any different.
author: Michael H.

description: This place sucks.  I thought it was the bouncers who were being non-sensical jerks by turning away cover-PAYING guests because the place was "to full" even though the entire second room (where my friend's band was playing) was empty.  But actually, they were just acting on the instructions of the owner, who called the cops when I asked him why he was denying entry.  Ok, maybe he called the cops because I called him a cocksucker, but still, denying entry, thereby reducing the bar and the band's take of the door, is just plain lame.  I wish I could give it zero stars.
author: Aaron F.

description: Good neighborhood bar - music is hit and miss.  I've seen some great bands and some not so great bands.  Drinks are cheap, service is quick and friendly.
author: M J.

description: Pretty chill dive bar, but if you want a cooler crowd and a cleaner feeling spot, I recommend Columbus Cafe.  They do have live music or comedians every now and then which is pretty cool.  Check it out, it's worth spending some time in if you live in SF!
author: Nelson W.

description: Hole in the wall saloon style place with way too much ghetto music. I mean this is North Beach, not East Oakland. Ohh and mouthy loud blonde wench behind the bar...."STFU!" Being a bartender is about your customers not about you.
author: J.B. A.

description:
hmmmmm
definitely have to say that there's a hottie behind the bar 
love the live bands and the atmosphere here 
but could be a little bit bigger 
but i love that its a dive bar in north beach 
you don't have to dress up 
you can just order a beer and chill listen to live music and meet great people
author: sarah c.

description: Good place to listen to music and drink and maybe dance if the music is good - was fun the night we went.
author: Jen D.

description: In all honesty, one really can't go wrong with any of the bars on the stretch that is Grant ave.  However, Grant and Green is a head above the rest as a result of the quality of its music venue.  If the citizens of the US were willing to spend two terms on GWB, I think the people of SF owe it to themselves to spend one night with North Beach's own Green president.
author: Justins L.

description: Live music, beer, and cool peeps. Could you really ask for more?  Well, yes... but... that's not the point.  Cool joint!
author: Giorgina G.

description: I've been to this bar many times since it is just a couple blocks away from my apartment but the show I saw a couple weekends ago confirmed my feelings on this bar.  I saw one of my friends play in General Jones (great, great bad!) and it was an amazing show.  This location is great because they show fantastic music acts for FREE!   It is a great space - plenty of room to get nice and sweaty on the dance floor!  So, despite the door guy who smacks my ass as I enter the bar I will be a return customer again and again!
author: Kate J.

description: Many years ago someone set me up w. a BLIND date; he was sooo ugly I suggested that we go to Grant & Green for some dancing and I was a little happier getting a few drinks, dancing in the dark and barely seeing that pudgy mug he had. Bad lighting works for BLIND date scares.
author: miriam b.

description: Fun. Fantastic staff. Bands are great.  Drinks are cheap for Nth Beach.  I will be back.  Whenever I bring friends in here, they have a great time.  Mixed crowd.  It can get busy though, so be prepared to fight for your space. Great happy hours every week night.
author: D B.

description: Lovin it.  Pretty much every time I've ever been here is playing with my band LowFat (we play tomorrow night June 6 btw).  It's a little small, but the size tends to keep everyone moving and having a good time.  One thing though, it can get super loud!  But it's all in good fun.  Drinks are fairly priced and there are even tables with tall chairs so you can sit and drink while talking to someone standing next to you at eye level.  Worthwhile stop when bar hopping.
author: Garrett G.

description: Goddamn.  And I mean GODDAMN.  Where are you finding these bands these days???  Not only are they talented, they are damn good looking!  Thank you for the dance floor!
author: Squid V.

description:
To the people who are assuming half of your drink money goes to the "shitty cover band" I'm here to tell you, as a member of a shitty cover band that played this place, we don't get squat.

Me and 8 other musicians played for nearly 5 hours, brought over twenty of our own friends into the place, got people dancing on the floor and the bartender gave us 100 to split 8 ways.  Plus we got ONE free drink each.  Don't hate the bands.  All in all a nice enough place.  Drinks are a little expensive for a weeknight.  The bartender was nice and attentive.

As a side note, you may want to bring brass knuckles or a switchblade to this place, my friend's face is broken because 7 muggers hit him out in the street in front of the building.
author: James B.

description: Probably have been here a dozen times, but honestly i never remember much of it.  That said, this is a sweet place to end up the night at the bars, especially if you are tired of savoy down the street.  The bartenders aparently can put with a lot from the drunken idiots that come in there around closing time (myself definately included!), so they have that going for them.. and as far as i can tell the drinks are good....  also, huge bonus points for the close proximity to North Beach Pizza...
author: Robert R.

description: I headed on down to Grant & Green to catch a sweet show by a Tom Petty cover band called "Heavy Petty".  Though it's small, there was still plenty of room for our sizeable group to kick back at a table, enjoy the [rockin'] band, and watch folks shake what their mamas gave them.  The bar line was short and the bathrooms were even decent.  Come on ladies...you know that's a big deal.  The "Git er' Done" special of the night was $2 Olympia beer in the can.  Can't beat that; plus it makes you feel like an Olympian.   Best part: I can walk there and stumble back.
author: Beth G.

description: One of the long-time live music venues in North Beach, G&G is a tiny little venue where you're never more than about 20 feet from the stage, but it's a great place to see a band up close and enjoy a beer.  And when you get hungry after all that drinking, golden boy is just around the corner!
author: Don H.

description:
Great place. Check out this portfolio of the venue:
http://www.shastic.com/portfolios/venue/grant_and_green
author: Axel G.

description: This bar gets loud and crowded quickly. The drinks are priced well, and there are pool tables in the second room so it's worth the trip.  Fun place to drink, and I've heard it's a good place to come watch a baseball game.
author: Catherine K.

description: On a karaoke Tuesday about a year ago I made the biggest decision of my life at this place. I don't know if it was the strong drinks, the fact that I sang a Partridge Family song, or the film student I was with...but that night made my life what it is today. For better or for worse, five stars just for that.
author: Penelope C.

description:
Go here and order a Gargoyle,
and start trippin on how freakin drunk it will have you in a matter of seconds.
author: Sleep E.

description:
They didn't kick us out when we arrived at 9:30 pm blacked out from an all day pub crawl.

That get's an "A-OK" in my book anyday.
author: Catherine M.

description: A little gem in North Beach.... and really dark.  A true neighborhood bar.
author: Annabel G.

description: I was lucky enough to have a good bartender who made a good drink. The live music hadn't started yet, which was good, since I was in the mood to talk and not yell. I usually walk right by this place since its always crowded and loud, but it was a good spot to have a quick drink during the week.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Corona in a CAN?  WTF mate?  Beer selection is mediocre, and priced high for the selection.  It smells like vomit in there ALL THE TIME!  Bartenders are a bit brusque.  And the bouncers tolerate NOTHING!  No shinanogans?  WTF MATE?
author: Max M.

description: Went there once while some jazzy/salsa type band was playing. Dont remember a whole lot of it except for the fact the band let me and my friend play on the drums and keyboard for a while during their break and then serenaded my friend!! It wasnt too crowded and easy to get a drink. Best part, it was right around the corner from Golden Boy Pizza!!
author: Erin F.

description: I like this small space to listen to live music on an off night.  Not good when it gets super crowded on weekends or during North Beach drinkfest events.
author: Jessica H.

description: Grant and Green is a good bar. It was not hard to get a drink or few and the crowd was very diverse. I didn't get a chance to see who the live band was that night but there was a good sized crowd for them (I left before they started). The highlight of my night was a guy from Boston that came up to me and my friend telling me how great Boston sports teams are. Being a S.F. native I countered his argument with the late 80's bay area sports teams. Niners back to back superbowls, A's 3 world series appearances in a row, Bay Bridge series and the Warriors Run TMC wasn't all that bad either. After I divulged that information on him he said you're good and then went back to his friends. Shortly after we left and continued our rampage through north beach.
author: D J.

description:
This place has horrible management.  I walked by the place the other day, and heard a band sound checking.  They sounded great, so me and my friends decided to stick around til they started.  Well, an hour passed, and then another hour.  Decided to ask them what was up, and they said that the bar manager doesn't want live music during beer pong, cause it might scare the beer pongers out.  

I remember playing beer pong in college, with a live band, and didn't think the two clashed.  I would have much rather heard some live music than listened to some frat boy's iPod playlist.  Well, eventually the band announced that they were cancelled, and the crowd left in herds.  So my friends and I decided that the band was being treated very badly, and that we could not support a bart that thought beer pong and live music weren't a cool mix.

We ventured down to 15 Romolo, where the drinks were original, the bartenders were voted best in San Francisco, and the manager was super friendly and even sent us out a free app after we had told him about the management out at Grant and Green.  

So if you are in the North Beach neighborhood, I highly recommend 15 Romollo as the place that you become an avid patron of because of its cool atmosphere, highly inventive cocktail menu, and great people.
author: Michael C.

description: I love this bar!  They have live bands every night or at least it seems like they do every night.  I've seen some great bands and there's always a good group of people there.  The bartenders are nice and last weekend when my friend was cold the bartender offered his jacket!  I recommend this bar to anyone headed to North Beach plus there are a million bars right next door.
author: Heather S.

description: When I first moved to the city, I asked the cab driver to take me someplace fun and mellow. He first dropped me off at Columbus Cafe...excellent, well done driver then after a drink or two I mosed up to this place. There was a chick on stage that looked just like Yoko Ono (Sp?) The crowd was really mellow and just enjoying the music. It was a Tuesday night (I was still unemployed) I was WASTED! Before I knew it, I had myself, my friend, and three random guys back at my house drinking beers and having a dance party till the wee hours... Needless to say, this bar pours a stiff drink, draws a fun crowd and makes me do stupid shit...I like it.
author: Lisa K.

description: It was a slow night last night because it was Thanksgiving, but the owner was hanging out there (or atleast he said he was the owner, i was a couple drinks down, he may have just been trying to impress me).  this is the type of place I call a bar's-type bar. yeah.
author: Lindsay T.

description: Sorry , I liked it better when it was a dive with an eighth inch of water on the very small bathroom floor. The Grunt and Groan was "the" dive in NB. Now it's what? Loss of soul.
author: Mag N.

description: Cute little bar on Grant, almost like any other. There was a live band (Maybell or Maybelle) playing jazzy-esh music that night. The crowd was cool, not super young and not super old. Just HOT HOT HOT in there, they could bust a window or something open, overall good decent kind of place, if you're looking to just sip a couple of beers and chill to some loud local-ish music.
author: Irene L.

description: best dive bar ever.  Real peeps posers easily WEEDED out! For pro's only! After 11 Fernet shots 4-8 happy hour!!
author: francisco M.

description: It can be AWESOME or just SOOO lame...I have had some insane nights at G & G.  Take a chance.on a Fri night and grab a beer at G & G. They sometimes have some really fun bands...
author: Laura J.

description: I met a couple people early in the evening around 8:30 on a Saturday night.  Like any other bar at that hour, things were quiet.  The scene at Grant & Green started to pick up once the bands began playing.  The two bands, Just Off Turner and 5 A.M., were surprisingly good rock bands--props to whoever booked them.  The crowd was young, hip-looking, and fun.  At the bar, the bartenders were friendly and quick.  In addition, the draft beer selection was standard bar fare and moderately  priced at $5 per pint (at least for Stella Artois).  Overall, great place to begin a night out in the North Beach area.
author: Andrew F.

description: The drinks are ~eeena~. Some good music at times, hit and miss. Great location, but never seen it too busy except on the weekends. And on the weekends North Beach isn't what it used to be. Who told the frat-boy trust fund babies to come douche-it-up here? There's some decent pubs, but Grant n Green... hmm I'll say props for providing a venue for musicians, and for free, there's your two stars!
author: Boom Z.

description: this place is cool man.  We played here early this year and had a full house of crazy SF residents.  drinks are faily inexpensive and bartenders nice.  no parking though.
author: Chi-Chong s.

description: Not to bad.  I somehow always meet people when i go here.  I like to start off here and move on because the place can get a little packed and a little warm.  Cool atmosphere, good beers on tap, and almost always a good jam band playing.  My only problem is the bouncers always give me crap about my I.D. cause its from forever ago and out of state.  I guess its reason enough to get a new one.
author: Jonathan F.

description: A simple bar with live music several nights a week, what more do you need?  Check to see whose playing...
author: Sam B.

description: small neighborhood joint. there's a stage that caters to live bands. i actually came here to watch some friends perform. jahlectrik...check them out! decent amount of people there on a tuesday night. not really a bar thats in my hood but definitely a chill spot to kick it if you're in the area.
author: Linda N.

description: OMG! Love this place! I bartend in the north beach area as well and know good bartenders/bars when I see em! The bar manager Zack, Blaze, Zoe and Scott are awesome! they are super fun, attentive and just all together rad! I love this bar and I highly recommend it! Live bands and Kareoke all week long. Looking for a good time? you'll find it here!
author: Kelley A.

description: right next to the lost and found, this place is usually busy on the weekends. a very low-key and 'rougher' crowd than i usually am used to, but it can be a fun place to get a beer and watch a ballgame.
author: Michelle I.

description: This place smells bad and seems to attract a crowd of people of the likes of San Quentin Graduates.  If you still want to check it out, just be aware that the bartenders are RUDE.  There are a couple of bold guys (barkeepers cause they can't mix drinks) with a nasty attitude.
author: Monica R.

description: I mostly go to Grant and Green right after work when its slow and the crazy neighborhood beggers, drunks, and/or methheads provide entertainment outside.  Good local hangout and the prices are about the same as anywhere around here.  Live music everynight is a big plus..... And.... Want to kill some brain cells with friends on a weekend afternoon?  Go to Grant and Green and enjoy their "Regulation Beer Pong" tables.  I hadn't played beer pong since I was 18! What a blast!!!
author: Adam L.

description: What a freaking hole. I'm not sure what is worse the coked out owner trying to nail the drunkest girl he can find or the puke smell as soon as you walk in. The service sucks, the drinks sucks, the staff is rude (not the girls). Don't waste your time.
author: Patrick C.

description: this place is, for lack of a better word, cool...  the bartenders are there to have a good time and it rubs out on the crowd.  live bands cram in there but it matters not!  the place is just all about being cool and having a good time.  car bombs flow like water and i welcome that whole heartedly.
author: Swarup B.

description: considering the location, this bar is a winner in my book. free live music, comedy and cheap drinks. and they have $3 absinthe shots during happy hour - which runs pretty late btw. don't take a date here, unless you have a GREAT date.
author: Zhenya S.

description: i came here on a wednesday night and it was pretty dead.  the loud hiphop seemed incongruous in relation to the dark pub feel, and all the cheap beers are served in cans (i hate cans).
author: Roshni R.

description: Grant and Green is great.  Extremely fun place, great live music (if you can, see the Sublime cover band.. they are awesome!), and good priced drinks.  I have had a great time every time I've come here.  The crowd obviously varies night to night, but I feel like the crowd is a step-up from your typical Marina/North Beach crowd.  Obviously not anything amazing or earth shattering, but it's always a great time.
author: Wayne S.

description: Post college crowd the night I went.  Perfectly fine band, tall, handsome all-American boys standing around holding beers.  I'm nearing 50 and went with a younger work colleage.  I liked the band and did not feel uncomfortable here - except the bathroom scene seemed a little odd.  It was a unisex bathroom with a door that did not seem to lock, so take someone with you to guard the door.
author: Andrea P.

description: definite dive bar, don't usually visit this bar however we heard that there was a great cover band there that evening so of course we had to go and see.... wow the band was great and this was a really great venue to see a live band, very roomy and they have TVs that monitor the stage...so you're up front even when you're not. The drinks were on the pricey side and the bartenders seemed to have hearing problems....a rum and coke because a vodka diet, umm...shouldn't you be used to the noise level already? also the floors feel like they have been drowned in sugar you literally stick to the floor not good when you  are in heals...overall though a great experience
author: Joy Y.

description: Went to see a little band here last weekend with some friends.  The band was cool, but good lord it was hot in there!  Felt like 110 degrees.   The drinks, service and locations were all "ok".
author: James B.

description: This place ROCKS! it's exactly what i look for in my saturday night exploits.. live music, cheap and strong drinks, and some pretty chill people. there are plenty of other places to go if i wanted another typical yuppie bar. when i come here, i get old school north beach. crazed poets who've partaken one too many times, aging musicians who long for the good old days of cheap rent and easy women, and a bartender who actually knows a thing or two about good music (alternating between matisyahu and barrington levy).
author: shyla r.

description: they have good live music from different artist the bartenders are cool, bouncers are wanna be's but its a fun place that is always guarentee  a good time
author: Nicolette E.

description: fuck yeah! great bands, great staff, and decent priced drinks for being up there in n. beach. throw in some scary bikers that hang out on weekends and a couple acts of extreme violence right outside the door, god damn i love that fuckin place.
author: Ausewaldoe J.
